discourse_list.title: ERC-1155 - Soon to be finalized, but one remaining point concerns existing smart contract wallets

content.content: This was Tweeted today by @PhABC:  ERC-1155 is soon to be finalized, but one remaining contentious point concerns existing smart contract wallet and the general problem of smart wallets supporting future standards.    github.com/ethereum/EIPs      Issue: ERC: Multi Token Standard  	 	opened by coinfork 	on 2018-06-17 	 	 	  --- eip: 1155 title: ERC-1155 Multi Token Standard author: Witek Radomski <witek@enjin.com>, Andrew Cooke <andrew@enjin.com>, Philippe Castonguay <pc@horizongames.net>, James Therien <james@enjin.com>, Eric Binet <eric@enjin.com> type:...
I assume that they worked out this one remaining point. So, ERC-1155 is final, yay!  https://blog.enjincoin.io/erc-1155-the-final-token-standard-on-ethereum-a83fce9f5714

jpitts:  the general problem of smart wallets supporting future standards   This is not a problem with tokens standards, it’s a problem with smart wallets not being upgradeable. Once you provide a smart wallet with upgradeability mechanisms, this is no longer an issue.
